bug.author: superserg8
bug.summary: Porcupine Issue: Failed to archive iOS build (react-native)
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behaviour</denchmark-h>
Archive without failing. <denchmark-h:h3>Actual behaviour</denchmark-h>
Can't archive react-native build (demo), have the same error as in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Picovoice/porcupine/issues/22>#22</denchmark-link>
bitcode bundle could not be generated because '.../node_modules/@picovoice/porcupine-react-native/ios/pv_porcupine/libpv_porcupine.a(pv_porcupine.o)' was built without full bitcode. All object files and libraries for bitcode must be generated from Xcode Archive or Install build for architecture arm64 <denchmark-h:h3>Steps to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
Download Porcupine iOS Demo Product > Archive

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kenarsa>@kenarsa</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/laves>@laves</denchmark-link> any updates on that? As a temporary solution, I disabled bitcode in Build Settings for the whole project but this is the wrong way for production...
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/superserg8>@superserg8</denchmark-link> we were able to reproduce the bug and we're testing the fix now. Expect a patch in the coming days!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/superserg8>@superserg8</denchmark-link> , the fix to the porcupine iOS lib has been merged in. On our end we're able to archive all of our demos. Please confirm this and we'll close the issue. Thanks for reporting!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/laves>@laves</denchmark-link> yep, it works now, thanks a lot!
